Chat

Class ChatConnectionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Chat.ChatConnectionHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ChatConnectionHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    ChatConnectionHandler is in charge of listening for connections from and initating connections to remote hosts. Because it must wait for new connections, the class is designed as a thread, with a main loop that simply blocks while waiting for new connections to arrive. The class also contains methods to initiate outgoing connections in response to commands from the main class. Once a socket has been created (either receving or outgoing), this class attaches two new threads to it: one for reading data from the socket, and one for writing new data out to it. These threads are implemented using the ChatSender and ChatReceiver classes. $Id: ChatConnectionHandler.java
    Version:
    May 25, 2015
    Author:
    Jessica, Nanxi, Prachi, Period: 2, Assignment: CHECKERS, Sources: Simple Chat

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatConnectionHandler

        public ChatConnectionHandler(ChatDisplay cd,
                     int p)
        Constructor. Creates a new thread listening on the given port. Also, remembers the display object, which it passes on to other threads as they are created.
        Parameters:
        cd - The display object to pass on to child threads
        p - The port to bind to and listen on

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Main thread method. Should simply contain a loop that waits for incoming connections and spawn()s new threads for them as appropriate.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:

      • connect

        public void connect(SocketName name)
        Create a new outgoing connection socket with the parameters provided in the socket name. Also, notify the display class of the new socket once it's created.
        Parameters:
        name - The name and connection parameters of the socket to create

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(SocketName name)
        Destroy an existing connection socket with the parameters provided in the socket name. Also, notify the display class that the socket has been destroyed.
        Parameters:
        name - The name and connection parameters of the socket to destroy

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String s)
        Iterate over all socket sending threads and tell them to send the given data.
        Parameters:
        s - The data to send
